data.title: Phillip of France, I Duke of Orléan - The Collection
data.meta_description: Phillip of France, I Duke of Orléan, was the second son of Louis XIII of France and the Spanish Infanta Ana of Austria; born on September 21, 1640; died June 9, 1701, in Saint-Cloud. He was the father of Ma Luisa de Orleans, queen of Spain when she married Carlos II.
data.text:
Phillip of France, I Duke of Orléan, was the second son of Louis XIII of France and the Spanish Infanta Ana of Austria; born on September 21, 1640; died June 9, 1701, in Saint-Cloud. He was the father of Ma Luisa de Orleans, queen of Spain when she married Carlos II.

This canvas is one of a group of portraits collected by María Luisa de Orleans (1662-1689), first wife of Carlos II of Spain, which would become part of the Royal Collection. Some of these paintings must have decorated the Queen´s Gallery in the Alcázar (Madrid), a representation space where the Queen launched a decorative and iconographic program of exaltation of her dynasty. Others would be portraits of smaller relatives, generally of bust, that the sovereign would receive as a gift from them and that would decorate the private rooms of her room.

Bibliography +

Sánchez Cantón, Francisco Javier, Museo del Prado. Catálogo de las pinturas, Museo del Prado, Madrid, 1972.

Museo Nacional del Prado, Museo del Prado: inventario general de pinturas (I) La Colección Real, Museo del Prado, Espasa Calpe, Madrid, 1990.

Geddo, Cristina, New Light on the Career of Jacob-Ferdinand Voet, The Burlington Magazine, 1176, 143, 2001, marzo, pp. 138-144.

Aterido Fernández, A.; Martínez Cuesta, J.; Pérez Preciado, J. J., Colecciones de pinturas de Felipe V e Isabel Farnesio: inventarios reales, II, Fundación de Apoyo de la Historia, Madrid, 2004, pp. 150.

Puerto Mendoza, Eduardo, Una serie de retratos de escuela francesa del Museo del Prado en relación con la colección de María Luisa de Orleans: sugerencias y precisiones, Philostrato. Revista de Historia y Arte, 4, 2018, pp. 5-32 [26].

Other inventories +

Inv. Real Museo, 1857. Núm. 1914.

"Rigaud / 1914. Retrato de un personage desconocido con armadura. / alto 2 pies, 6 pulg; ancho 2 pies."

Catálogo Museo del Prado, 1872-1907. Núm. 2073a.

Inv. Felipe V, Furriera del Rey, 1747. Núm. 296.

Ottro de un hombre con una Corbatta a lo antiguo de vara escasa de Caída y tres quartas de ancho de mano no conocida [f. 331v] en doscientos Reales

Museo Real de Pinturas a la muerte de Fernando VII, 1834. Núm. 929.

DEPÓSITO ENTRESUELO [...] Nueve cientos veinte y nueve. Retrato del Personage armado / Rigaut / Lº / 120

Inv. Testamentaría Carlos III, Buen Retiro, 1794. Núm. 929.

Otra [pintura] de Rigau, con el retrato de un Personage armado, de tres quartas y media de alto y dos tercias de ancho obalada...120
